result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedric D Atkins

8:46 AM Defendant Cedric D Atkins in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Cedric D Atkins.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests another status to review the offer and digital. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with victim Business Heights Finance except for restitution purposes. No contact with the victim Y.M.S (person, property, residence or family) Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

*AMENDED 05/13/22* DEFENDANT MAY HAVE A GPS MONITORING EXCEPTION FOR VERIFIED EMPLOYMENT. EMPLOYMENT AND HOURS MUST BE VERIFIED WITH PRE TRIAL SERVICES.

**AMENDED ON 9-7-22: GPS/HOUSE ARREST CAN BE REMOVED.**
NG plea entered.

Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. RCAP files a letter, no violations on house arrest and requests to remove GPS.  State take no position.  BTC: Bond modified to remove GPS and house arrest.

9:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cedric D Atkins in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel at this time, SPD needs more time to appoint,.
Defendant moves to address bond, requesting a signature bond, gives argument.
State objects to bond modification with argument. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits to give SPD time to appoint. Motion to modify bond granted, Bond modified to $5000 signature bond, conditions to include GPS Monitoring, exceptions only to go to court, meet with counsel, and medical appointment. No contact with Business or Victim in complaint. Informed on what could result if any violations were to happen. Defendant Needs to bring documentation from Treating Physician confirming treatment schedule to next court date.
